intro: Labordia molokaiana var. setosa, commonly known as the Molokaʻi hibiscus, is a rare flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokaʻi. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to habitat loss, it is considered an endangered species.
